main event: A white object the size of a man's head was observed moving slowly in Ringgold, Georgia on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was seen for 30 minutes, The observation included multiple types of readings: ground-radar, air-visual, and air-intercept radar, The flight path indicated the object was moving 5W, Venus was suggested as a potential explanation for the sighting, The object remains classified as unidentified due to insufficient data.
sighted object: one white object the size of a man's head
witness description: Civilian source, but no specific witnesses detailed in the report.
